title: Novak Djokovic speaks out as he suffers blow in pursuit of Rafael Nadal
text:
Novak Djokovic was beaten by Stefanos Tsitsipas in the Shanghai Masters quarter finals (Picture: Reuters)

Novak Djokovic admitted he failed to put Stefanos Tsitsipas under enough pressure after he slipped to a shock defeat in the quarter finals of the Shanghai Masters.

The defending champion looked on course for a routine win when he took the opening three games of the contest in just seven minutes but Tsitsipas battled back from a set down to complete a landmark 3-6 7-5 6-3.

Tsitsipas will now take on Daniil Medvedev in the semi-finals after the Russian ended Fabio Fognini eventful run to the last eight following a 6-3 7-6 (7-4) victory.

Stefanos Tsitsipas recorded a shock win over Rafael Nadal at the Shanghai Masters (Picture: AP)

Djokovic, meanwhile, who had previously never failed to reach the semis in Shanghai, now trails Rafael Nadal by 1,280 points in the battle to end 2019 as world No.1.

‘He was backing up his serve with really good and aggressive first shots in the rally.

‘I didn’t make him defend enough. I just gave him enough time to really dictate the play from back of the court and he deserved to win.’

The 21-year-old Greek, meanwhile, has now beaten Djokovic, Nadal and Roger Federer in the same season and has secured his presence at next month’s ATP Finals event in London.

‘I played really well and felt in the zone in the second and third set in the rallies we were playing,’ he said afterwards.

‘That gave me a lot of confidence going in knowing I could face him from the baseline. As the match progressed I felt better and better.

‘I felt my serve was going very well today and I wasn’t struggling with it too much. That was an extra boost for me out there.

‘I am really happy that I pulled out a great victory like this.’
